channel.title: Posts on Delay – a cool Hugo theme
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Delay – a cool Hugo theme

item.title: More math typesetting
item.description: Here’s some math typesetting stuff. For starters I’ll just write down the Linblad equation, a nice bit of physics for open quantum systems, $$ \frac{\partial \rho(t)}{\partial t} = \sum_j \gamma_j \left( L_j \rho(t) L_j^\dagger -\frac{1}{2} \lbrace L_j^\dagger L_j, \rho(t)\rbrace\right) -\lbrack H, \rho(t) \rbrack ~ .$$ Does $v = \nu$? How do $g$, $u$, $v$ and v, $w$, and $z$ look? This is slightly unrelated to the Linblad equation, since it’s classical, but I’m the God of this document, so I’ll also write down the Boltzmann equation, $$\frac{\partial f}{\partial t} + \frac{\partial H}{\partial\mathbf{p}} \cdot \nabla f + \frac{\partial H}{\partial\mathbf{r}} \cdot \frac{\partial f} {\partial\mathbf{p}} = \left( \frac{\partial f}{\partial t} \right)_{\text{coll}} ~ .

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Rich Content
item.description: Hugo ships with several Built-in Shortcodes for rich content, along with a Privacy Config and a set of Simple Shortcodes that enable static and no-JS versions of various social media embeds.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
